intro: Cotoneaster boisianus, commonly known as the Chinese cotoneaster, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It features small, oval leaves that turn red in the fall, adding ornamental value to gardens. The plant produces clusters of white flowers in early spring, followed by bright red berries that attract birds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Cotoneaster boisianus is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and seasonal interest.
